com.qti.snapdragon.sdk.digitalpen

Class DigitalPenManager.Settings

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.qti.snapdragon.sdk.digitalpen.DigitalPenManager.Settings
  • Enclosing class:
    DigitalPenManager

    public class DigitalPenManager.Settings
extends java.lang.Object
    The Settings class is the interface to settings in the Snapdragon Digital Pen service.

    To change settings using the Settings class:

    • Call DigitalPenManager.getSettings() to get a Settings object.
    • Change any of the desired settings.
    • Apply settings changes with apply()
    Only the last settings is applied if the same settings is changed multiple times before calling apply().

    To read settings using the Settings class, call any of the accessor functions in the class.

    Note: The settings values read will be "local" settings. That is, if you change a setting and query it without calling apply() first, the "local" setting will be returned which doesn't necessarily match that setting in the service.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      boolean apply()
      Apply all Settings with the Snapdragon Digital Pen service.
      DigitalPenManager.Settings clear()
      Clears the current settings, resetting them to defaults.

      Returns the maximum distance for off-screen hover events.

      Returns the current off-screen mode.

      Returns the maximum distance for on-screen hover events.

      Gets the mapping for the given area.
      boolean isEraserBypassed()
      Returns whether the system's eraser setting is bypassed.
      boolean isOffScreenHoverEnabled()
      Returns whether hover is enabled over the off-screen area.
      boolean isOnScreenHoverEnabled()
      Returns whether hover is enabled over the on-screen area.
      DigitalPenManager.Settings setEraserBypass()
      Allows the app to ignore the current global eraser button setting, which can switch the device to the eraser tool if enabled.
      DigitalPenManager.Settings setEraserBypassDisabled()
      Stops bypassing the global eraser button setting.
      DigitalPenManager.Settings setOffScreenHoverDisabled()
      The calling app will not receive pen hover events when the pen is over the off-screen area.
      DigitalPenManager.Settings setOffScreenHoverEnabled()
      The calling app will receive input events when the pen is hovering above the off-screen area within DigitalPenManager.DEFAULT_MAX_HOVER_DISTANCE in the Z axis.
      DigitalPenManager.Settings setOffScreenHoverEnabled(int maxDistance)
      The calling app will receive input events when the pen is hovering above the off-screen area within the maxDistance limit in the Z axis.

      Set how the off-screen area will be handled.
      DigitalPenManager.Settings setOnScreenHoverDisabled()
      The calling app will not receive pen hover events when the pen is over the on-screen area.
      DigitalPenManager.Settings setOnScreenHoverEnabled()
      The calling app will receive input events when the pen is hovering above the on-screen area within a default of DigitalPenManager.DEFAULT_MAX_HOVER_DISTANCE in the Z axis.
      DigitalPenManager.Settings setOnScreenHoverEnabled(int maxDistance)
      The calling app will receive input events when the pen is hovering above the on-screen area within the maxDistance limit in the Z axis.

    • Method Detail

      • apply

        public boolean apply()
        Apply all Settings with the Snapdragon Digital Pen service.

      • setOffScreenMode

        public DigitalPenManager.Settings setOffScreenMode(DigitalPenManager.OffScreenMode mode)
        Set how the off-screen area will be handled.
        Parameters:
        mode - new off-screen mode.

      • setOnScreenHoverEnabled

        public DigitalPenManager.Settings setOnScreenHoverEnabled()
        The calling app will receive input events when the pen is hovering above the on-screen area within a default of DigitalPenManager.DEFAULT_MAX_HOVER_DISTANCE in the Z axis.

      • setOnScreenHoverEnabled

        public DigitalPenManager.Settings setOnScreenHoverEnabled(int maxDistance)
        The calling app will receive input events when the pen is hovering above the on-screen area within the maxDistance limit in the Z axis.
        Parameters:
        maxDistance - the distance limit in mm

      • setOnScreenHoverDisabled

        public DigitalPenManager.Settings setOnScreenHoverDisabled()
        The calling app will not receive pen hover events when the pen is over the on-screen area.

      • isOnScreenHoverEnabled

        public boolean isOnScreenHoverEnabled()
        Returns whether hover is enabled over the on-screen area.

      • getOnScreenHoverMaxDistance

        public int getOnScreenHoverMaxDistance()
        Returns the maximum distance for on-screen hover events. The default is DigitalPenManager.DEFAULT_MAX_HOVER_DISTANCE.
        Returns:
        the current hovering maximum distance in mm.

      • setEraserBypass

        public DigitalPenManager.Settings setEraserBypass()
        Allows the app to ignore the current global eraser button setting, which can switch the device to the eraser tool if enabled.

      • setEraserBypassDisabled

        public DigitalPenManager.Settings setEraserBypassDisabled()
        Stops bypassing the global eraser button setting. The behavior of the pen buttons, in respect to enabling the eraser tool type, is determined by the global setting of the eraser.

      • isEraserBypassed

        public boolean isEraserBypassed()
        Returns whether the system's eraser setting is bypassed.
        Returns:
        true if the eraser is bypassed, false if it is being left to the system default.

      • getOffScreenMode

        public DigitalPenManager.OffScreenMode getOffScreenMode()
        Returns the current off-screen mode.
        Returns:
        the current off-screen mode.

      • isOffScreenHoverEnabled

        public boolean isOffScreenHoverEnabled()
        Returns whether hover is enabled over the off-screen area.
        Returns:
        the current hover setting, or false if in incorrect off-screen mode

      • setOffScreenHoverEnabled

        public DigitalPenManager.Settings setOffScreenHoverEnabled()
        The calling app will receive input events when the pen is hovering above the off-screen area within DigitalPenManager.DEFAULT_MAX_HOVER_DISTANCE in the Z axis.

      • setOffScreenHoverDisabled

        public DigitalPenManager.Settings setOffScreenHoverDisabled()
        The calling app will not receive pen hover events when the pen is over the off-screen area.

      • setOffScreenHoverEnabled

        public DigitalPenManager.Settings setOffScreenHoverEnabled(int maxDistance)
        The calling app will receive input events when the pen is hovering above the off-screen area within the maxDistance limit in the Z axis.
        Parameters:
        maxDistance - the distance limit in mm

      • getOffScreenHoverMaxDistance

        public int getOffScreenHoverMaxDistance()
        Returns the maximum distance for off-screen hover events. The default is DigitalPenManager.DEFAULT_MAX_HOVER_DISTANCE.
        Returns:
        the current hovering maximum distance in mm

      • clear

        public DigitalPenManager.Settings clear()
        Clears the current settings, resetting them to defaults.

        Like with other settings, this doesn't take effect in the service until apply() is called.

      • setSideChannelMapping

        public DigitalPenManager.Settings setSideChannelMapping(DigitalPenManager.Area area,
                                               DigitalPenManager.SideChannelMapping mapping)
        Sets the mapping for the given area. Platform must support DigitalPenManager.Feature.SIDE_CHANNEL.

        Note: DigitalPenManager.Area.ALL does not support DigitalPenManager.SideChannelMapping.SCALED.

        Parameters:
        area - the area

      • getSideChannelMapping

        public DigitalPenManager.SideChannelMapping getSideChannelMapping(DigitalPenManager.Area area)
        Gets the mapping for the given area. Platform must support DigitalPenManager.Feature.SIDE_CHANNEL.
        Parameters:
        area - the area
        Returns:
        the current side channel mapping
